sistema

Class Cinema

  • java.lang.Object
    • sistema.Cinema

  • public class Cinema
extends java.lang.Object
    Cinema.java

    A representation of a cinema. A cinema is characterized by the following attributes: name, address, a manager and a list of rooms. It also keeps track of the id of the next room and of the id of the next show schedule.
    A cinema is uniquely identified by its name and address.

    Version:
    2.0, 24 June 2017
    Author:
    Sara Martino

      • addSala

        public int addSala(java.lang.String nomeSala,
          int numeroFile,
          int numeroPostiFila,
          int tempoAttrezzaggio)
        Adds a room to the rooms list.

        Returns -1 if there is already a room with the same name, the id of the new Sala otherwise

        Parameters:
        nomeSala - The name of the new room
        numeroFile - The number of seats row
        numeroPostiFila - The number of seats per row
        tempoAttrezzaggio - The setup time of the room
        Returns:
        the id of the new Sala if the new room is added, -1 otherwise

      • hasSala

        public boolean hasSala(int roomId)
        Returns true if the cinema has a room with this id.

        Returns false if the id is not a valid id.

        Parameters:
        roomId - The id of the room
        Returns:
        true if the cinema has a room with this id, false otherwise

      • removeSala

        public boolean removeSala(int id)
        Removes a room from the rooms list.

        Returns false if there is no room with the specified id.

        Parameters:
        id - the id of the room to remove
        Returns:
        true if the room is removed, false otherwise

      • printAllRooms

        public boolean printAllRooms()
        Prints the info of each room in the rooms list.

        Returns false if the list of rooms is empty.

        Returns:
        true if there is at least one room in the list, false otherwise

      • printAllShows

        public boolean printAllShows(int salaId)
        Prints all the shows scheduled in the room specified by the id passed as input.

        Returns false if the id is not a valid id or if there are no shows scheduled.

        Returns:
        true if the operation is successfully completed, false otherwise

      • verifyRoomsAvailability

        public java.util.ArrayList<Sala> verifyRoomsAvailability(Spettacolo s,
                                                int numberOfDays)
        Verify the availability of the rooms of this cinema for the entire schedule of the show passed as input (depending on numberOfDays that represents the number of days you want to keep the show in schedule).

        Returns an empty list if no room is available.

        Parameters:
        show - The show for which you want to check the availability of the rooms
        numberOfDays - The number of days you want to keep the show in schedule
        Returns:
        The list of the available rooms if present, an empty list otherwise.

      • addShows

        public boolean addShows(Spettacolo s,
               int numberOfDays,
               int idSala)
        Adds a a show schedule (defined by the show and the number of days you want to keep it in schedule) to the map programmazione of the sala (defined by its id) of the cinema.

        Returns false if the id of the sala does not exist, the number of days is zero or if the room is not available.

        Parameters:
        show - The show to add
        numberOfDays - The number of days you want to keep the show in schedule
        idSala - The id of the sala in which you want to add the shows
        Returns:
        true if the operation is succesfully completed, false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.

        Returns false if the other object is null or if it is not an instance of the class Cinema. A cinema is equal to another cinema whether they have the same name and address ignoring case.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the reference object with which to compare
        Returns:
        true if this object is the same as the obj argument; false otherwise
